comments.comment:
I think we can follow the example from Master dealing with SessionExpiredException:


    if (t != null && t instanceof KeeperException.SessionExpiredException) {

      try {

        LOG.info("Primary Master trying to recover from ZooKeeper session " +

            "expiry.");

        return !tryRecoveringExpiredZKSession();

Can we just retry if it is session expired exception? Currently, it just retry in case of (RecoverableZooKeeper):

case CONNECTIONLOSS:
case OPERATIONTIMEOUT:

In HMaster, this.zooKeeper is replenished:


  private boolean tryRecoveringExpiredZKSession() throws InterruptedException,

      IOException, KeeperException {

    this.zooKeeper = new ZooKeeperWatcher(conf, MASTER + ":"

        + this.serverName.getPort(), this, true);

To handle expired session in a general way, we need to update the ZooKeeperWatcher of the caller.
